duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop comprehensive technical architecture, design, and blueprint of IT solutions for Federal programs.
Apply industry best practices and federal architecture standards to develop tailored solutions during proposal development.
Apply analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills to find and present technology solutions aligned with customer requirements.
Work closely with Capture and Proposal Managers, Partners, and the Operations division to shape innovative and high-quality solutions.
Own the technical volume, level of effort estimations, and overall solutions design following proposal submission and contract award.
Lead brainstorming sessions, provide technical reviews, design concepts for graphics, technical research, and proposal content authoring.
Present technology solutions to leadership, customers, and Federal CIOs.
Collaborate with Business Development and Capture teams throughout the business development cycle.
Create and manage technical response development for proposals using virtual communications tools.
Evaluate the technical response for accuracy, cohesiveness, compliance, and compelling solution conveyance.
Provide consulting, delivery, and operational support and expertise for projects.
Support the start-up and delivery of won proposals, assisting in job interviews, work assignments, and briefing executive leadership.
Represent the organization as a technology solutions expert at industry events, customer engagements, and Federal technology forums.
Perform engineering duties on current contracts as a subject matter expert and help adopt new technologies or meet complex contract deliverables.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business, or related technical discipline (Master's preferred)
Professional certifications such as AWS, Microsoft, Cyber Security, Agile, and DevOps are strongly desired.
Experience supporting Federal agencies including CMS, DHA, DHS, VA, HHS, and NIH.
Public Trust Clearance or the ability to obtain one.
